formalpara.title: Analysis
formalpara.para: When parsing each token of an expression string, it's possible that we can try to parse a function, but that function is syntactically invalid. This needs to be thrown back up when it is encountered. Thus, when we check on the type of the node, if we do not have one of the types of the node that we expect, this means that the parsing of the function node should have succeeded, but it did not, which implies an error that we should throw at this point.
